headline: Calico Bean Casserole
description: Kidney beans, baked beans and butter beans are combined with ground beef, bacon and onion in this hearty dish. You can also put the ingredients into a slow cooker and cook for about 8 hours on low.

video.description: See how to make a delicious bean and beef side dish.
video.name: Calico Bean Casserole

name: Calico Bean Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 (16 ounce) can baked beans with pork

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a large skillet over medium heat, fry the ground beef, bacon and onion together until ground beef is no longer pink. Drain fat.

In a large mixing bowl, combine the kidney beans, baked beans with pork and butter beans. Stir in the ketchup, white vinegar, dry mustard, brown sugar and cook beef mixture. Mix thoroughly, adding salt and pepper to taste.
Pour the bean and meat mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake in preheated oven for 30 to 40 minutes.

review.reviewBody: This with scalloped potatoes and ham is one of my favorite dinners!!

It's really good recipe as is.. I've made many times.. Always drain & rinse kidney beans, drain butter beans.. , Bush's Grillin beans . I have substituted many different BBq sauces for the ketchup. I usually add green pepper along with the onion . Im a tangy girl ,so more vinegar, less brown sugar. Thanks for the recipe: )

This was the second time I made this delicious bean recipe. Unfortunately, sometimes I cook like a bride, and that's what I did this time. I added a 12 oz. package of frozen baby limas along with the canned beans but didn't precook them and they weren't cooked enough. Tonight I added all the leftovers to a pot and slowly simmered them about 30 minutes, and this is the dish I remember loving.
love it

A tweak that I use in this is to use smoked sausage cut in 1/4 inch rounds instead of the ground beef. I also use 4 cans of beans-usually add black beans to what recipe calls for and drain and rinse all but the baked beans-Bush's of course! Reduce the brown sugar but sometimes add a little molasses, use more onion and a little green or red or both adds to the flavor levels. Great recipe-for us it's a meal and add some corn muffins-perfect!!

I made it as is the 1st time I made it and it was a little sweet, but it was great! I've made it many times since with these changes: I use a 28oz. can of Bush's original baked beans, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/2 lb. of bacon, 1 tbsp. white vinegar, and 1 pepper (I usually mix 1/2 red and 1/2 green peppers). It's not quite as sweet and the peppers add something is was missing!
I followed the recipe and then added bbq sauce. It turned out great!

My husband loved this recipe, as did I. I made it as written except added some diced green and red bell peppers to the mix. I also used great northern white beans as I did not have butter beans. The only thing I would change is to drain the kidney and white beans, as after forty minutes of cooking the dish was still too soupy to serve on a plate. Flavor was great though!

This recipe is mostly identical from an old freezer meal cookbook. Beloved by everyone who eats it. You can used any vinegar or mustard, half the beef but not the bacon. Throw extra cans of beans in if you need to feed a crowd. Freezes beautifully before or after cooking. Baking is preferable over the crockpot but still tastes great.

Used one extra can of Grilling Beans 
Used 1 lb. of bacon (you can never have too much bacon!)
Used 1 c. onion

Loved this recipe served with mashed potatoes and corn. Old home cooking!

Used one extra can of Grilling Beans 
Used 1 lb. of bacon (you can never have too much bacon!)
Used 1 c. onion

Loved this recipe served with mashed potatoes and corn. Old home cooking!

I was very excited to try this and thought all the ingredients are tasty on their own so together would be great. Wrong. Wayyyyy too sweet and I only used 1/2 cup of brown sugar. I love sweet things, but not this. I think in order to enjoy this recipe you have to remember 2 things. 1-this in no way is reminiscent of ham and beans & 2-if you make this you better like pork and beans. Sadly I doubled recipe so it was a waste of time and ingredients.

Something was off about this for me. If it’s supposed to be eaten as a meal, it’s too sweet & I’d prefer it be seasoned more like traditional chili. If it’s supposed to be a baked beans side dish, it doesn’t have that flavor profile either. I tasted it after adding each ingredient from the recipe. It started tasting off to me after I added the vinegar (and I love vinegar). Even before I added sugar I wasn’t a fan, so I don’t think it’s the sweetness. I wanted to like this, but it just didn’t make sense to my taste buds.
Delicious!

I made this as the main course rather than a side dish. It was hearty and filling served with bread or biscuits. I followed the recipe as shown and it was very good and easy. When I make this again, however, I will reduce the amount of brown sugar because it was too sweet for me. For my taste, I might even skip the sugar altogether or maybe substitute molasses, and throw in a half cup of cut green beans just for color and crunch. Otherwise, a great recipe!

We like this as a side dish so I use only about 1/4 pound ground beef--just enough to make people wonder what's in it. Honestly, it's just the right amount! I also drain the beans, otherwise too soupy. Beans can easily be swapped out per individual taste preference. Great recipe. Have been making it for decades!
It was a simple but good recipe. I made it as written. If I make it again I will cut the amount of brown sugar. It was a bit to sweet for our preference. Thank you for sharing.
I made this dish for my church’s picnic. The only thing I did was adding a green bell pepper the best tasting beans I ever tasted. They were gone less than half an hour!
No changes except doubling next time! We loved it!
It is very tasty! I would not use all the liquid in the cans next time, as it wS very runny.
Excellent!
Served as main course. Made as noted except doubled the baked beans. This is one of those dishes that it is really hard to put down your fork.Hubby and I both loved this recipe.

Great recipe! I sprinkled some flour over the ground beef For browning at the end and to thicken the beans up a bit. I also added a packet of McCormick mesquite grilling packet to the mix. I didn’t have any bacon, and it was still awesome!
No changes except drain the beans excluding the baked beans
These are good but way too sweet for us to enjoy as a main dish. I’ll make again but only as a side.
Stayed true to the recipe except for cooking the bacon separate and loved it.

Made this for the Super Bowl; it was the best part of the night. Left out the beef. Sautéed small onion and three garlic cloves. Used (drained) black, navy and red beans with 2 cans barbecue beans. Add a finely diced, seeded, jalapeño and a diced green pepper. Cooked in a slow cooker on high until they boiled then turepned to low. All other ingredients the same. Excellent.
Wow this is delicious.( I added a teaspoon of Worcestershire sauce , but didn’t need it)
I drained the beans that had water in it. Sometimes I drain too much, but the taste is great!
Was soooo good. Perfect for me. Gonna make it again soon!
At least one person makes a version of these at every potluck I've been to. I like to add a pinch of cayenne or chipotle chili powder to mine. Just can't pass up the hint of heat.
I drained the butter and kidney beans. It was good but next time i make it i will cook the bacon first. The mushy chunks werent very good.

I followed the recipe except that I cooked the bacon separate, and changed kidney beans to chili beans. I couldn't find butter beans, so I also subbed that with great northern beans. All other ingredients I used in the amount provided, and this was a winner for all in our family. Served as main dish with side of Trader Joes cornbread. Next time I will double, as this had just enough for a family of 5 and everyone was wanting to claim the leftovers for their lunch.

I love this recipe, make it all the time when the weather gets cool. I use northern beans instead of butter beans and the light kidney beans. Throw everything in my crock pot and let it simmer all day. Eat it as a meal with corn bread and a salad. Delicious!u

I made it using about half the sugar it called for and it was still very sweet. If I make it again I will probably leave the sugar out. I realize that this recipe should be sweet but that isn’t for us.
I didn't drain the the beans, it was kind of runny, next it won't be runny

I have made this a few times, I do a vegetarian version that I really like with veggie burger crumbles, cannellini beans instead of baked beans and bacon bits (from soy).

In both versions I found that the bacon becomes soggy and I really don't like that, so I either omit or use as a topping when serving to retain the crunch
Just like my Grandma's. Only she used 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1 TBSP molasses. Not sure that would even make any difference.

It's really good. I slow cooked it for six hours on low instead of using an oven and it turned out well. TOO well. Now my mom wants me to make it for every family outing. There's a birthday in the family, make the beans. We're going on camping trip that you're not going on, make the beans. I'd give it 5 stars, but it loses a star for being annoying. 4/5

This is an excellent recipe. I made it in my slow cooker. I combined all the ingredients in the slow cooker exactly as written, but didn't add any extra salt. I cooked for 3 hours on high. Perfect results!
DELICIOUS!

First time making this and the children loved it. I did make a change to speed up the making i used already cooked bacon and crumbled it into the meat and onion pan. I found this easy and less grease.
Made the recipe exactly as written and it was delicious. quick and easy, it is now in our dinner rotation!!
nice dish

My wife and mother in law enjoyed this dish very much. It was easy to make and I followed the recipe exactly the first time. I can’t really say if anything would change the second time around. Anyway great dish that sticks to your ribs.

For the beans I substituted three cans of tri-bean blend (kidney, pinto, black). I pre-cooked the bacon just a bit to ensure it was done to my liking (just sky of crispy) at the end of the cooking time. We ate it with rice, and sealed the leftovers in lunch-size servings. Delicious! Definitely will make again.

This is the best baked bean recipe ever. I have been making it for years.It is a recipe that came from my mother, who also made it. I get compliments every time I serve it and have shared this recipe several times over. Easy and delicious.
I made this exactly as the recipe called for and I really don't see how you could improve on it much. Wow! This is delicious!
This is wonderful! This was also my grandma's recipe and probably made for 50 years in my family. I decrease the sugar a bit and add about 1/2 cup water to thin it slightly. Always loved by all!
This was delicious. My whole family loved it. I added a dash of Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder and a little bit of red pepper flakes.
Very good. my sister uses chili beans so I think I will try those next and I want to try black beans to give it some kick.

I had this many years ago at a moving party. It was filling and delicious so I'm so happy to have found this recipe! Very versatile as others mentioned.... I used two cans of Pork & Beans, w/one can of kidney and 1/4c Sweet Baby Rays BBQ for extra liquid... YUM! We'll be making again for sure.
I add a can of black beans and some Kielbasa and serve it over rice and it is absolutely divine! Freezes well, too! Great dish!
Very good. I didn't use all that brown sugar. The bakes beans themselves are sweet. I think next time I make them I will add another can of beans.
Great beans!!! Added 1/2 C grandmas molasses and substituted yellow mustard- 1Tbspn for the dry mustard & vinegar. Wonderful taste!!!
Was asked for the recipe. Loved recommending allrecipes.com!
I read others reveiws and cut the brown sugar to 1/2 cup it was a hit!
Have made this recipe 4 or 5 times now. We like it better than my prize winning chilli on cold days! If you are a bacon lover like we are, you will be very happy adding more bacon!!
This was delicious. I added Italian Sausage with the hamburger and it was great! Will definitely make again!

I made this for a family gathering. I used lima beans instead of kidney beans and doubled the recipe. The only thing I would do differently next time is drain some of the liquid off the beans because it was runnier than I like.

I've made this for years. I use ground turkey and once it's mixed together we can't taste a difference. I also use pre-cooked bacon to cut down on prep time. I chop it and toss it in with the ground turkey and there's no difference. This is my oldest son's favorite dish.

I cooked bacon separately and instead of butter beans I used great northern beans. I also added 3 sliced hot dogs. I got so many comments at the 4th of July party. Definitely my favorite recipe for baked beans.
Served over rice. Delicious!
Great, Too bad I burned the bread. We ate this as a main dish. Will make again.
This recipe rocks and is my new go-to bean recipe! I didn't & wouldn't change a thing. Thanks so much for sharing!
I cut back on the brown sugar and added a can of drained French cut green beans(added to the color and taste.) Doubled it for a holiday picnic and less than a spoonful left.
Always a favorite at our house. I find that I can cut back on the brown sugar without negatively affecting the flavor.
So good! I made exactly as recipe called for. Just make sure you make a lot if it's for a pot luck, will go fast!

Next time I will cook the bacon until done, it does not render down very well as directed, then sauté' the onion in with the bacon. I would probably cook the hamburger separately in the bacon drippings after removing the bacon and onion.
Good and bad. The good, I made this for my husband's turn for food at his weekly poker party. They loved it! The bad, I have been nominated to cook every week from now on!

No large change but once in awhile I lay strips of provolone cheese over the top and allow it to melt and turn golden brown. Seems to hold moisture in and enhances the flavor just a bit. Most times I make large batches and freeze in advance of a barbecue or seasonal gathering at work. Always a hit.

This is an easy and wonderful bean/beef barbecue for a one dish meal with a salad, or a take-along to a picnic. I added less brown sugar. It depends how sweet you like it. I would think this would taste nice with ground turkey as well.

My family raved about these. Didn't stray from the recipe too much; may have put a little less catsup in. Will definitely be making these again. Served alongside cheeseburgers made on the Foreman grill. Awesome!!! Thanks Dee Dee!
Made as directed. Super Flavorful, family loved it. Next time I will drain at least one can of beans. Too much liquid.
I substituted fake ground beef and fake bacon. the main problem was that it was way too sweet. If I make it again I will use half the sugar.
Does anyone else think it's strange to give a recipe 5 stars but then say "I changed this and this and this and this"?? I made it exactly as written and it was great!! Will definitely make it again.

My family really enjoyed this dish. I was asked to save the recipe to make it again. 
I made a small modification tho, I thought I had dry mustard in the pantry, but didn't. I substituted the dry with a teaspoon and a half of regular yellow mustard.
This recipe is delicious! Although, we substituted baby beans for the butter beans. This could definitely go on a bun-sloppy Joe style.
Very good and easy! I never have dry mustard on hand, so I use 1/2 cup yellow mustard. Other than that I make it the same and it is great to take to a potluck or to have as a main dish.

I made this recipe tonight and enjoyed it very much. I did make one change; cutting the brown sugar to 1/4 of a cup. Other than that, I followed the recipe as written. I will make this again. Thanks for sharing!
This was good, but didn't make the cut. Won't be making it again.
Next time will use barbeque sauce instead of ketchup and will leave out the ground beef. Otherwise, we liked it.

It is baked beans made more substantial with ground beef. It would be a great pot luck item. I happen to love baked beans so this recipe makes it something I can serve as a main dish. It is a great dish to put in the oven when you've got a lot to do because if it cooks longer it only gets better (to a point).

This was vey good, and my guests loved it. I would only change one thing, and that would be frying the bacon ahead of time, rather than frying it with the hamburger. It didn't get done mixed in with the ground beef., at least not to my liking. I will make it again.
this recipe is in church cookbook. now it is easier to find!

I've made this several times. It's great as written or with variations. Great dish to bring to a potluck, or to serve on buns as sloppy joes. I drain the beans and often add jalapenos, liquid smoke, a dash of hot sauce, and less or no sugar. If you want to make this without ground beef, just add an extra can of beans.
Tasty, easy, and kid-friendly. I skip the sugar and bacon to save a few calories.
I used to make something very similar to this as a side dish without the hamburger, but I like the idea of adding hamburger to make this a main dish. I also reduced the amount of brown sugar.
Wow....should have read the other critical reviews......this was way, way, way too sweet.

Haven't tried this particular one yet but its the same ingredients for my Big Boy Beef n Beans recipe I've used for years (got from my ex-MIL). Our recipe calls for Liquid Smoke however, which really gives the dish some yummy flavor. Been awhile since I've made it, now I'm craving it lol.

This is a mandatory dish at our family reunion. I rarely measure anything and change it up every once in a while, but even though they never come out the same way twice, everyone loves them. I use all of the listed ingredients with the exception of dry mustard, I use prepared and I use cider vinegar instead of white. I also cook the bacon until crisp and remove and drain it leaving some of the bacon grease in the pan to saute the onions in. I cook the ground beef separately so that I can drain the grease off of it. With the exception of the pork and beans, I drain and rinse all of the other beans. I use dark red kidneys, baby butter beans because they are closer in size to the others and pinto beans. I always add lightly sauteed red and green bell peppers and sometimes hot Hungarian wax peppers. I also sometimes add sauteed matchstick cut carrots. If I have an opened bottle of barbeque sauce in the fridge, I put some of that in as well. I have made this with all ground beef and with beef and sausage, either way it is alway a hit. I take it to the reunion in a six quart slow cooker and I am disappointed if there is not any leftover since it's just the two of us and it makes too much to be practical to make regularly at home. You really can't go wrong with this when you adapt it to suit your tastes. If you don't like really sweet baked beans, use less sugar. If you like a little heat add hot pepper. The key to a successful recipe is to taste as you go and adjust accordingly.

I have been making this recipe for at least 20 yrs. I do use Hot It. sausage as my favorite but I will divide 1/2 hot & 1/2 sweet It. sausage. Much more flavor over ground beef. Always requested for picnics & large gatherings.

This was a bit too sweet for me. Sugar depending on your sweetness preference. When I am serving to people who enjoy some heat in their food I often make a jalapeño cornbread or even add some diced jalapeños to the casserole. All in all this is a nice winter casserole that lends itself to a bit of doctoring to fit your own tastes.

This exact recipe was in a slow cooker cookbook I bought a few years ago and it was called Mrs. Grady's Beans. It has been a staple in my house for years. Real crowd pleaser. I use as a main dish, not a side dish as it is filling. Sometimes I lighten it up by using turkey bacon (or less real bacon) and less sugar to reduce the calories a little. It's really delicious. It doesn't reheat very well though. If you microwave leftovers it just doesn't taste the same as when you eat it the first time.
I make these all the time but I also use a can of black beans drained and rinsed and use pork sausage instead of ground beef.
This was a perfect simple dinner for a rainy, cool day. Delicious comfort food, is what I would call it. Made according to directions and it was perfect. I didn't find it too sweet.
Loved all the beans in this filling main dish. Only complaint from hubby was that he wanted more bacon thrown in. LOL This dish got tastier for leftovers.
Really easy. I use 1.5 lbs of burger and 0.5 lb of bacon. If going to transfer to a crock pot after in the oven, double the recipe because it only fills the crock pot 1/2 full.
Big hit at a dinner I took it to. I've made it twice now, only calico beans I will make!
